info.name: Rune Mage
info.description: A magical class specializing in the drawing and infusing of runes to create enhancements.
info.author: Custom

feature.name: Rune Drawing
feature.description: At 1st level, you can draw magical runes to create various effects. You start with three runes. Rune of Protection: Provides temporary hit points equal to 1d4 + Intelligence modifier for 1 hour. Rune of Speed: Increases the target's speed by 10 feet for 1 minute. Rune of Blade: Adds 1d4 damage to a weapon for 1 minute.

feature.name: Rune Infusion
feature.description: Starting at 2nd level, you can infuse runes into items, granting them permanent effects. This process takes 1 hour and 50 gold per rune level.

feature.name: Rune Mastery
feature.description: At 3rd level, choose a rune specialization: Protection, Power, or Transmutation. Protection: Gain the ability to draw the Runic Shield, adding +2 to AC for 10 minutes. Power: Gain the ability to draw the Runic Strike, adding 1d6 magical damage to a weapon for 10 minutes. Transmutation: Gain the ability to draw the Runic Transmutation, changing the material of an object for 1 hour.

feature.name: Ability Score Improvement
feature.description: At the 4th level and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score by 2 or two ability scores by 1. You cannot increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

feature.name: Greater Rune Drawing
feature.description: At 5th level, you can draw advanced runes. Choose two new runes from the advanced rune list. Rune of Power: Adds 1d6 magical damage. Rune of Resistance: Adds +1 AC and resistance to a damage type. Rune of Speed: Allows an additional attack as a bonus action.

feature.name: Runic Empowerment
feature.description: At 6th level, your runes' effects last twice as long.

feature.name: Runic Infusion Mastery
feature.description: At 7th level, you can infuse two runes into one item, combining their effects. This process takes an additional 2 hours and costs 50 more gold.

feature.name: Greater Runic Smithing
feature.description: At 9th level, you can create advanced weapons and armor with more complex runic effects.

feature.name: Master Rune Drawing
feature.description: At 10th level, you can draw master runes. Choose two from the master rune list. Rune of Resurrection: Allows the casting of Resurrection spell. Rune of Transcendence: Grants immunity to one damage type. Rune of Mastery: Doubles the duration and effect of any one rune.

feature.name: Ultimate Rune Craft
feature.description: At 20th level, your mastery of runes reaches its peak. All runes you draw last indefinitely until dismissed, and you can draw up to three runes simultaneously on a single item or person.
